component.name: Label
component.description: Accessible text label associated with a form control.

useCases: Labeling form inputs, selects, checkboxes, and radio buttons
Providing accessible names for interactive form controls
Displaying field labels in form layouts

commonPatterns.name: input-label
checkbox-label
commonPatterns.description: Label beside a checkbox using peer association

commonPatterns.name: with-field-component
commonPatterns.description: Label used inside the Field component for structured form layouts

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Label without associating it to a form control
antiPatterns.reason: An unassociated label provides no accessibility benefit
antiPatterns.alternative: Always use htmlFor matching the control's id, or wrap the control inside the Label

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Label for non-form text headings
antiPatterns.reason: Label has semantic meaning for form controls; headings should use heading elements
antiPatterns.alternative: Use h1-h6 or CardTitle for headings; use p or span for descriptive text

antiPatterns.scenario: Hiding the Label visually without sr-only
antiPatterns.reason: Form controls always need accessible names; hiding without sr-only removes accessibility
antiPatterns.alternative: Use className='sr-only' to visually hide while preserving screen reader access

parentConstraints: Typically used inside a Field component or a manual form-field wrapper

interactions.click: Clicking the label focuses its associated form control (native label behavior)
interactions.disabled: Reduces opacity to 50% and disables pointer events when the associated control or parent group is disabled

responsive.mobile: Block-level label above the form control
responsive.desktop: Block-level label above the form control; can be placed inline in horizontal form layouts

accessibility.role: label (native HTML label via Radix Label primitive)
accessibility.keyboardSupport: Clicking label focuses associated control; no direct keyboard interaction on the label itself
accessibility.screenReader: Announces label text as the accessible name for the associated form control
accessibility.focusManagement: Label itself is not focusable; transfers focus to associated control on click

rules: Always associate Label with a form control via htmlFor or by wrapping
Uses Radix Label primitive for consistent cross-browser behavior
Styled as text-sm, font-medium with user-select none to prevent text selection
Inherits disabled styling from parent group-data-disabled or peer-disabled
Supports inline content alongside text via flex layout with gap-2

aiHints.context: Use for every visible form control to provide an accessible name. Pair with Input, Select, Checkbox, Switch, or RadioGroup. When using the Field component, Label is typically the first child. For icon-only or visually hidden labels, apply sr-only class.
